title: John Grierson
brief_description: John Grierson’s address on the occasion of the “Thirty Years of the British Documentary” season at the National Film Theatre, London, in August 1959. He outlines the basic intentions of the early documentary filmmakers and the influence which British documentary has since had on the rest of the world.
